alert.note: Alert for Laurens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 9:55PM EDT until June 24 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. The Little River is causing flooding at Little River Park in Laurens. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Laurens. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, secondary roadways, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may be impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 942 PM EDT, Streams across Laurens County remain elevated due to multiple rounds of heavy rain which began Wednesday evening. Much of Laurens County received 3-6 inches of rain over the past 24 hours, with Doppler radar estimating 6-8 inches of rain for isolated locations between Gray Court and Waterloo. The resultant floodwave is starting to leave the headwater locations, including the Little River in Laurens, and work downstream. High flows has caused flooding of adjacent low-lying areas across the county, including some low-lying roadways. It will take several more hours for streams to crest and recede back below bankfull. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will be issued to replace the previous Flood Warning for residual nuisance flooding overnight. - The following streamgauge is above Action/Advisory Stage, resulting in nuisance flooding along Little River... ID: LRLS1 NAME: at Gordon St, in Laurens CURRENT STAGE: 9.25 feet CREST: 9.39 feet on June 21 at 7:00 PM TREND: Falling Steadily ESTIMATED FORECAST: The Little River will gradually recede tonight and fall below bankfull later overnight or early tomorrow morning. IMPACTS: The Little River is causing nuisance flooding of Little River Park, impacting the Little River Greenway and adjacent low-lying park property. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Laurens, Clinton, Joanna, Gray Court, Cross Hill, Waterloo, Mountville, Ora, Enoree and Kinards.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Obey all barricades, even if no water is over the roadway. Barricaded roads may have been compromised by earlier high flows and flooding and may not be safe for travel.
